@tuohai666 I just tested raw JDBC, it works well with jdbcType="LongVarchar".
As @fifadxj said, the problem is caused by Sharding-JDBC's `setCharacterStream` in `AbstractShardingPreparedStatementAdapter` calling `this.setParameter` instead of `statement.setCharacterStream`

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)

Split XML by database type, each database has a independent XML configuration.
Each database type has two XML: `sql-statement-rule-definition.xml` and `extractor-rule-definition.xml`. 
Has tow common xml for `extractor-rule-definition` and `rule-rule-definition`.

Format of `sql-statement-rule-definition.xml` :

```xml
<sql-statement-rule-definition base-package="io.shardingsphere.core.parsing.antlr" optimizer-base-package="optimizer.impl">
    <sql-statement-rule context="createTable" sql-statement-class="xxx.XXXStatement" extractor-rule-refs="xxx1, xxx2" optimizer-class="XXX" />
   <!-- more sql-statement-rule-definition  -->
</sql-statement-rule-definition>
```

Format of `extractor-rule-definition.xml` :

```xml
<extractor-rule-definition extractor-base-package="io.shardingsphere.core.parsing.antlr.extractor.impl">
    <sql-segment-rule id="xxx" extractor-class="XXX" />
   <!-- more extractor-rule-definition  -->
</sql-segment-rule-definition>
```

Format of `filler-rule-definition.xml` :

```xml
<filler-rule-definition sql-segment-base-package="io.shardingsphere.core.parsing.antlr.sql.segment" filler-base-package="io.shardingsphere.core.parsing.antlr.filler.impl">
    <filler-rule sql-segment-class="XXX" filler-class="XXX" />
   <!-- more filler-rule-definition  -->
</filler-rule-definition>
```
